head.title: World Briefing | Europe: Cyprus: Concern Over Turkish Threat

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Government, Philanthropy and NGO

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Europe: Cyprus: Concern Over Turkish Threat

abstract.p: Alvaro de Soto, United Nations envoy, visits Turkey and says he hopes that settlement can be reached over fate of Cyprus before divided island's Greek Cypriot government joins European Union; map (S)

block.p: A United Nations envoy visiting Turkey, Alvaro de Soto, said he hoped that a settlement could be reached over the fate of Cyprus before the divided island's Greek Cypriot government joins the European Union. Prime Minister Bulent Ecevit of Turkey said over the weekend that Turkey could annex the northern third of the Mediterranean island if plans for union membership proceed. Cyprus was partitioned in 1974 after an invasion by Turkish troops to stop a coup attempt by people who wanted unification with Greece.
